Dating: NEW KINGDOM (not before); NEW KINGDOM; LATE PERIOD (not after)
Technique: FORMED BY HAND; PAINTED; ENGRAVED; FAYENCE
Name: Bead necklace
Description: This necklace in faience is composed of several elements found in a tomb at Gurob during the excavations of W. F. Petrie. One notices the oblong pearls and  circles of blue and greyish colours dating from the New Kingdom, several amulets in the form of a small plaque with figurative decoration and hieroglyphs, in the form of a rosette, of a leaf and of a menqebit-sceptre (E. 4168) and scaraboids  of a more recent date.
